metadata.name: DEFOREST TO FLAUNT IT
metadata.description:
Garimpeiros (prospectors) of the rarest and most valuable diamonds in South America live in Espigão do Oeste, a small town in Rondônia.  
 The Bloodstained Stones, seen from above, is a dark spot amidst the vast green of the forests and plains of the Amazon Jungle. Up close, you can see that it is the main gateway to the Roosevelt Indian Land. A coveted piece of the Amazon rainforest has sparked a silent war between Indians and whites, and supplies an international network of clandestine trade in precious stones for jewelry, accessories and luxury goods.  The use of diamonds to finance terrorism is nothing new! Diamonds kill and leave irreversible damage to the biome.

Art by: LUCIANO CIRILO  
Size: 12500X12500px  
           300dpi  
           39.5 MB  
CONCEPT: @O.Y.X COLLECTIVE
